text: Fermat’s theorem and the Mean Value Theorems Aditya Ghosh Last updated: Dec 01, 2020 1. Suppose that f : [a, b] → R has a local maximum at x = c, where c ∈ (a, b). Is it necessary that f ′(c) = 0? 2. Suppose that f : [a, b] → R has a local maximum at x = c, where c ∈ [a, b]. Assume that f is diﬀerentiable at x = c. Is it necessary that f ′(c) = 0? 3. (Fermat’s Theorem) Suppose that f : [a, b] → R has a local maximum (or minimum) at x = c, where c ∈ (a, b). Assume that f is diﬀerentiable at x = c. Show that f ′(c) must be equal to zero. (Note: It is enough to show it only for the case of local maximum. If f has a local minimum at x = c, then we can just apply that result to −f .) 4. Suppose that f : [a, b] → R is diﬀerentiable at x = c, where c ∈ (a, b). If f ′(c) = 0, is it necessary that f has a local maximum/minimum at x = c? 5. (Rolle’s Theorem) Suppose that f : [a, b] → R is continuous on [a, b], diﬀerentiable on (a, b), and f (a) = f (b). Prove that there exists c ∈ (a, b) such that f ′(c) = 0. 6. Show that Rolle’s theorem fails to hold if f is not continuous at one of endpoints (a or b). 7. (Lagrange’s Mean Value Theorem) Suppose that f : [a, b] → R is continuous on [a, b], diﬀerentiable on (a, b). Prove that there exists c ∈ (a, b) such that f (b) − f (a) b − a = f ′(c). 8. Let f be continuous on [a, b], diﬀerentiable on (a, b) and f (a) = f (b) = 0. Prove that for any β ∈ R, there exists some c ∈ (a, b) such that f ′(c) + β · f (c) = 0. 9. Let f, g be continuous on [a, b], diﬀerentiable on (a, b) and f (a) = f (b) = 0. Show that there exists c ∈ (a, b) such that g′(x)f (x) + f ′(x) = 0. 10. Let f be continuous on [0, π], diﬀerentiable on (0, π). Show that there exists c ∈ (0, π) such that f ′(c) sin c + f (c) cos c = 0. 11. Assume that f is continuous on [a, b], diﬀerentiable on (a, b), where 0 < a < b, and suppose that bf (a) = af (b). Prove that there exists x0 ∈ (a, b) such that x0f ′(x0) = f (x0). 1 12. Suppose that f is continuous on [a, b], diﬀerentiable on (a, b), and suppose that f (b)2 − f (a) 2 = b2 − a2. Prove that the equation f ′(x)f (x) = x has at least one root in (a, b). 13. Let f and g be continuous and never vanishing on [a, b] and diﬀerentiable on (a, b). Prove that if f (a)g(b) = f (b)g(a) then there is x0 ∈ (a, b) such that f ′(x0) f (x0) = g′(x0) g(x0) . 14. Assume that a0, a1, . . . , an are real numbers such that a0 + a1 2 + a2 3 + · · · + an n + 1 = 0. Show that P (x) = a0 + a1x + · · · + anxn has at least one root in (0, 1). 15. Let P (x) be a polynomial with real coeﬃcients and degree n ≥ 2. Prove that if all roots of P (x) are real, then all roots of P ′(x) are also real. 16. Let f be continuous on [0, 2] and twice diﬀerentiable on (0, 2). If f (x) = x holds for x = 0, 1 and 2, then show that there exists x0 ∈ (0, 2) such that f ′′(x0) = 0. 17. Let n > 1 be an integer, and let f : [a, b] → R be a continuous function, which is n-times diﬀerentiable on (a, b). If the graph of f (x) has n + 1 collinear points, then prove that there exists c ∈ (a, b) such that f (n)(c) = 0. [Here f (n)(c) denotes the n-th derivative of f (x), evaluated at x = c.] 18. Let f, g : [0, 1] → R such that f (0) = g(0) and f ′(x) > g′(x) for all x ∈ (0, 1). Show that f (x) > g(x) must hold for all x ∈ (0, 1]. 19. Suppose that f is continuous on [a, b] and diﬀerentiable on (a, b). If f ′(x) > 0 for every x ∈ (a, b), prove that f must be strictly increasing on [a, b]. 20. Let f : R → R be a twice diﬀerentiable function, with positive second derivative. Prove that, f (x + f ′(x)) ≥ f (x) for every x ∈ R. 21. Show that the equation 3x + 4x + 5x = 6 x has exactly one real root. 22. For non-zero a1, . . . , an and for distinct θ1, . . . , θn, show that the equation a1xθ1 + a2xθ2 + · · · + anxθn = 0 has at most n − 1 roots for x ∈ (0, ∞). 2 23. (Cauchy’s MVT ) Let f, g be continuous on [a, b], diﬀerentiable on (a, b). Prove that there exists c ∈ (a, b) such that (f (b) − f (a)) · g′(c) = (g(b) − g(a)) · f ′(c). Comment: If we also assume that g′(x) ̸= 0 for every x ∈ (a, b), then it rearranges to the following: f (b) − f (a) g(b) − g(a) = f ′(c) g′(c) . 24. Suppose that f is continuous on [a, b], diﬀerentiable on (a, b), where 0 < a < b. Prove that there exists c1, c2 ∈ (a, b) such that f ′(c2) a + b = f ′(c1) 2c1 . 25. Let f be continuous on [a, b], diﬀerentiable on (a, b), where a > 0. Show that there exists c ∈ (a, b) such that bf (a) − af (b) b − a = f (c) − cf ′(c). 26. Suppose that f : [a, b] → R is continuous on [a, b] and diﬀerentiable on (a, b), where b − a ≥ π. Prove that there exists x0 ∈ (a, b) such that f ′(x0) < 1 + f (x0) 2. 27. Suppose that f : [a, b] → [a, b] is continuous on [a, b], diﬀerentiable on (a, b), and satisﬁes f (a) = a, f (b) = b. Show that there exist c, d ∈ (a, b) such that c ̸= d and f ′(c)f ′(d) = 1. 28. Let f : (−1, 1) → R be a twice diﬀerentiable function. Suppose that f (1/n) = 1 holds for every n ∈ N. Prove that f ′(0) = 0. Furthermore, show that f ′′(0) = 0. 29. Given that, f (x) = 8x3 + 3x. Find the value of lim x→∞ f −1(8x) − f −1(x) x1/3 . 30. Suppose that lim x→∞ f ′(x) = ∞. Does this imply that f (x) is unbounded? 31. Let P be a polynomial with real coeﬃcients. Let the leading coeﬃcient be a (where a > 0) and the degree be b. Show that, lim n→∞ ( P (n + 1)1/b − P (n) 1/b) = a1/b. 32. Suppose that f is twice diﬀerentiable on (a, b) with positive second derivative. Prove that for any x, y ∈ [a, b] and any λ ∈ [0, 1], it holds that f (λx + (1 − λ)y) ≤ λf (x) + (1 − λ)f (y). 3
